title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Computer Hardware and Electronics Engineers

content.rendered:
What are Computer Hardware and Electronics Engineers?

Computer Hardware and Electronics Engineers design and build computers and related devices. They also test and experiment with new designs for products such as circuit boards, keyboards, and printers.

Where do Computer Hardware and Electronics Engineers work?

  • Computer systems companies
  • Electronic manufacturing companies
  • Government

How much do Computer Hardware and Electronics Engineers make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for Computer Hardware and Electronics Engineers is $78,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Computer Hardware and Electronics Engineers?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Computer science majors
  • Electrical engineering majors
  • General engineering majors
Search relevant jobs

Computer Hardware and Electronics Engineers skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Computer Hardware and Electronics Engineers succeed in their work:

  • Quick thinking skills
  • Attention to detail
  • Teamwork and leadership skills

What are some common questions about Computer Hardware and Electronics Engineers?

Q: What education does a Computer Hardware and Electronics Engineer need?

A: At least a bachelor’s degree in a related field for an entry-level position.
